Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_G10184
Reviews.Content: Shangri La in Paris is a beautiful hotel with nice rooms, nothing out of the ordinary though. The location is excellent as it is a walking distance away from the main attraction of the Eiffel Tower. We found the atmosphere of the hotel a bit gloomy and whilst it is a beautiful hotel we were not overly impressed. The concierge service was excellent in helping us making dinner & show reservations. On the day we arrived i called them after 6pm to ask if they could arrange a cake, balloons, flowers and champagne to be sent the next morning as it was my husbands birthday, given that it was such late notice i didnt think they would manage to get everything but they exceeded my expectations and everything was lovely, especially the flowers. I liked this hotel and it was an overall good experience. We would have loved to try out the spa but at the time of our stay it was still under construction.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be - if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: pwarne
Reviews.Content: If you're holding the folding, and don't mind spending it on a hotel, then there is little better to spend it on than the Shangri-La in Paris. Sumptuous rooms, impeccable service, great food, all at an eye-watering price. Who cares, if you're on expenses?

Reviews.Title: “Stunning throughout”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1953
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location oppo the tower,beautifully refurbished building blending French design with Far Eastern touches and furniture.Comfortable spacious rooms with lovely bathrooms ,everything has been thought about and addressed very carefully.Staff are just welcoming,warm,helpful and friendly without going OTT.( none of this "have a nice day rubbish ")As it is relativley small hotel,less than 100 rooms ,is has a homely boutique feel to it especially in the guest areas. Will always use on my return to Paris.Cant wait for the pool to open late 2012

Reviews.Title: “Dreamlike wedding location”
Reviews.Author: Romeromeo
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to organise our wedding cocktail, dinner and party at the Shangri-La in Paris. Cecile, the Events Sale Manager, was extremely flexible in accommodating our various (many!) needs and requests and helped us to make this a truly unforgettable experience. Even as we had additional requests in the days and hours before the wedding ceremony, she was always extremely available, kind and responsive. It certainly made us feel that our wedding was in safe hands. As we live abroad, it was crucial to have such a great professional taking care of everything. We were touched by her commitment, as shown during the preparation period as well as during the big day itself. As for the venue, the different function rooms were simply gorgeous. The staff did a terrific job throughout the day (especially thanks to Ingrid and her team). Our guests were wowed not only by the unbelievably delicious food and the museum-like setting, but also the quality of the service. We felt that the whole event could not have been more perfect. To come back to the food, we had the opportunity to do a tasting dinner one week before the wedding in one of Shangri-La's restaurants. Again, outstanding service and great, great, great food. We stayed at the hotel for three nights. They very kindly upgraded us to a stunning duplex suite with, we believe, the best view in Paris and a very large terrace overlooking the Eiffel Tower. Again, service was impeccable throughout the entire stay (in-room breakfast in such setting is a real treat). It was a bit difficult to go back to the real world after having spent three days in such heavenly environment. If you are considering organising your wedding in a hotel in Paris, we would strongly recommend Shangri-La for its sheer beauty as well as its flawless service. We visited all major hotels in Paris before finally discovering Shangri-La (as they had just opened). For us, it was an obvious choice. We hope to return to Shangri-La Paris for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel in Paris . . . the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Mange2
Reviews.Content: Recently had the opportunity to sample some of the best-reputed hotel products Paris has to offer--a stunning selection at some pretty stunning prices. The Shangri-La was far and away the winner: superb location, fantastic staff and service and unquestionably the very best room with a view (and fabulous terrace) in Paris, Suite 306. This property is luxurious and comfortable, but fresh, bright and modern as well. The understated Asian touches--green tea on check-in--make a real difference. And while price range of luxury hotels in Paris may be wince-worthy, the Shangri-La was the only one of the lot that felt like value for money. A great experience and to be highly recommended for a special experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: ExtensiveTravels
Reviews.Content: We travel on a regular basis and typically stay at American Express fine hotels. Shangri-La was not on the Amex list, but it certainly should be! This was by far the finest hotel experience we have ever had. This hotel should be Number 1 in Paris! As an accountant and number cruncher at heart, I realized that the newness of the hotel and thus few reviews is why it is currently Number 82. It won't take any time for this hotel to rise to the top! The staff was amazing, especially the concierge desk. They could not have been more helpful or friendly. Each day the helped us with an itinerary and reservations, and often had a complimentary car take us to dinner. The time they took explaining the map actually made me familiar and comfortable traveling ourselves throughout Paris. Keep the map on you, because this is a very new hotel (Dec 2010) and several cab drivers have never been there. (the hotel address is on the front of the map) The rooms are gorgeous and the Eiffel views are incredible. Our room 306 was a Duplex Terrace Suite facing the Eiffel. We could see the beautiful tower from bed! Loved the heated floors in the bathroom too. There was a nice fruit arrangement always available. We found the property is in a very easy spot for traveling the city. We walked several days and also became familiar with the bus lines and metro with great ease. Our first night the concierge desk got us in to the Jules Verne, the posh restaurant on the 3rd floor of the Eiffel Tower. This was impressive, as they can have a 3 month advance reservation list! It turned out to be a very lucky thing for me as we got engaged there that night! Be sure not to miss the Shang Palace. It is a newly opened Cantonese style dining in the hotel and very fine food and service. It was our last meal in Paris and was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Room, Terrace, View! WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Lanphere
Reviews.Content: We splurged and got a terrace room. We never had such a romantic stay in Paris as this. The service was brilliant, the food EXCELLENT, the room comfortable and very clean, and the staff are just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Asian culture hits Paris”
Reviews.Author: tronson
Reviews.Content: Alighting from the cab, and being met by a real Doorman who elegantly welcomes you and just takes care of business - one's luggage - you realize you've nicely segwayed back into the land of luxury, and great [Asian] service. Entering this one-time Palace built in 1896, previously lived in by the Grand nephew of Napoleon Bonaparte, one cannot avoid being impressed by the architecture - and how so beautifully adorned it is with fabulous flower arrangements. Smiling faces welcome you from behind the Reception counter, and although the majority of staff are European, you sense undertones of Asian hospitality, transporting you to the best of what is back home. My wife and I glance at each other - and silently acknowledge , "now this is nice". Escorted to our attractively appointed room with a direct view of the Eiffel Tower, you become automatically geo-tagged of the location. Space was adequate, everything was where it should be, and it just worked. You opened the desk drawer and there was a good supply of stationary items. You plugged the supplied Ethernet cable into your laptop, and you were effortlessly on line and for free. And with a flick of the wrist, you were enjoying a nice cup of Welcome Chinese tea poured from a lovely tea service, reminiscent of what we did back in the mid 70's when I worked at (the now defunct) Hong Kong Hilton. A quick freshen up, and it was time to rendezvous with a friend for a pre-dinner drink in the Hotel's bar. A lovely cozy room made complete with superb background music, and very comfy surroundings. Service was impeccable and friendly - and the snacks accompanying the drinks complemented the experience in this intimate Parisian location. Awaking from a good night's sleep, my wife and I decided to take breakfast (especially since it was inclusive in the room rate) and sauntered down to the breakfast room, aptly named La Bauhinia - the Hong Kong emblem. In all the excitement and rushing around, we inadvertently were still running on UK time. Due to this irresponsible oversight, we arrived just before 11am thinking it was 10am - and I fleetingly noticed that the tables seemed to be more laid up for lunch than breakfast. That being said, we announced we were there for breakfast, and after a pregnant pause, the Greeter said, "they were in fact getting ready for lunch - but it's no problem, we will take care of you". WOW we thought - that was so nicely handled, and it could so easily have gone the other way - south - but thankfully, it didn't. A table was quickly cleared, and we were offered a sumptuous fare. It was a lovely experience, and my wife said they were the best-poached eggs ever. The server was so polite and friendly and had a lovely demeanor. I can't help thinking she must have been exposed through deep training to the Shangri-La way, and if so - kudos to the folks who did it. Checkout was very well handled, and a short exit interview conducted. I was asked if I needed a taxi, and confirmed we did - to take us to the Mandarin Oriental across town. Since there may be a delay, the Concierge suggested waiting in one of the small lounges off the main Lobby area, and we did just that for the first ten minutes. Getting anxious I ventured back to the Lobby and one of the Reception staff noticed me, enquired if all was ok and apologized for the delay even though it was not her problem. She then followed-up with the Concierge. A few minutes later the cab arrived, and we were off to the Mandarin, for part two of our Paris adventure. Room Rate: €695 (including Breakfast and Internet)

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable part of our family trip”
Reviews.Author: checkincheck0ut
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris as a family for 4 nights and chose Shangri-La Paris as it was the newest luxury hotel in town. I have to say, expectations are very high as we were paying 650 Euro per night for a standard room. As we arrived, we were all blown away by the grandness of the hotel. The entrance to the hotel was palace like, we were treated like royalty. Check-in was a breeze, took less than 3 minutes, and the receptionist personally guided us to our rooms, welcomed us with hot Chinese Tea along with fresh fruits and bottled apple juice. The standard room was everything we had asked for. Advertised as 37-42 sqm, we weren't sure which size it was, but it was definitely large. It had a walk-in closet which fit all our luggages comfortably, and a huge safe deposit box. The safe deposit box was large enough to fit a laptop standing up, which was amazing for an in-room hotel safe. The bathroom was spotless, clean and new, just how we want it. Everything looked brand new. Bathroom was also generously sized with 2 wash basins, an LCD built into the mirror, a spacious shower with rain forest or normal shower head comfortable enough for 2 adults, an individual toilet room with its own door, and a full sized bathtub. The room itself was also very nicely decorated, mostly a French decor fused with Oriental touches. The windows were very large and the curtains were of very high quality, no sunlight bled through in the morning from the sides, the top, or the bottom of the floor, which is rare these days in hotels. Breakfast was sumptuous, and my advice would be to get it included in the room rate, its truly luxurious. Rather than the usual buffet style breakfast, this was a personal American breakfast, but there was nothing American about it. It was a la carte style, the waitress took orders and brought everything to your table, but you could have as much as you want, seconds, or thirds, if you wanted. You could have yoghurts, cereals, juices, hot chocolates, tea/coffee, baskets of croissants and danishes, any kinds of toast, 2 eggs any style with chicken/pork sausages, bacon, you name it they got it. And as long as they got it, you can have it. I thought it would be a set thing where you choose and that's it, but I was surprised, they actually offer to give you more as long as you were still hungry. Definitely a generous touch. Like I said, if you didn't include this in the hotel rate, it goes for 48 Euro a head, so definitely a splurge if you had to pay everyday. The other room we had was larger and had a Eiffel Tower view which was breathtaking. When the tower started flashing on the hour at night, it was really worth it, to just sit by the large window and take endless pictures of it, which we did. But no review would be complete without mentioning the downsides. First of all, I was a bit disappointed by the electrical outlets the room provided. As a 5-star luxury hotel of international recognition, I was surprised to see only French electrical outlets. I was only able to charge my appliances one at a time, and that was only because I brought 1 universal adapter. So my iPad, iPhone, BB, and camera had to take turn being charged, which was annoying. My advice would be for the hotel to at least provide a universal adapter in the drawer somewhere for international travellers. Secondly, the room we had, felt a bit warm. The air-conditioner was blowing warm air no matter what setting we put. We woke up a bit sticky most mornings. I expect better from a 650 Euro a night hotel. But the other room was fine, so maybe they'll fix this as time goes by, after all the hotel has only been opened a few months. Gym was a temporary one, so it was small. They said a permanent one was being completed. I didn't see a pool, so I wasn't sure they had one. So for now, I'd say the Fitness facility is incomplete. Overall, this was an awesome stay, really made our Europe trip, it was very dreamlike, its no doubt expensive, but worth our while in every way. I have stayed in many luxury hotels, but Shang Paris no doubt is in my top 3 list now. Although its expensive, I thought the price was decent for Paris standard, and nothing beats its newness. I recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every second from the beginning till the end!”
Reviews.Author: NickL77
Reviews.Content: What can i say about Shangri La Paris. Its quite simply amazing and truly a memorable stay. We were there for our Honeymoon in August. The staffs there were truly exceeding the expectation, they were extremely helpful and very attentive whenever you need them. I had a planned with the staff in Shangri La for a suprised for my wife, they helped to executed it perfectly planned and timingly and yet they suprised both us with alittle extra more things, the room decorations were amazing. Our room was upgraded and have breathtaking view of the Effiel Tower from our terrence upstairs!. We spent mostly our nights there looking over the Effiel. My wife and I really had a wonderful, romantic and truly unforgetable memories. We will not trade it for anything in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - what more can you say!”
Reviews.Author: Shanst
Reviews.Content: We were bumped from another hotel and were put here in an Eiffel Tower terrace room. What a great piece of luck! They made us feel so welcome, from the tea to the welcome note it was just great. The room had the most amazing view of the Eiffel tower from the room, bathroom, terrace, everywhere. Loved the bathroom, especially the huge shower and tv in the mirror. Although rainy, loved the view from the terrace and the light show at night. Yes, it is a little way from the Champs Élysées but that made it even better for us. If we come back to Paris we will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of pluses, but some minuses too”
Reviews.Author: Bigtimeguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days with my wife on vacation. We were upgraded to a suite with an Eiffel tower view. Very nice touch. Staff was flawless. Rooms were spotless and perfectly appointed. Not a single complaint in that department. The location is not the best... On a side street next to Iranian embassy. Eiffel tower is a short walk but no shopping, restaurants, cafes, bars or anything else is around. The hotel is beautiful, like a museum inside but it and the location are missing that "it" factor in terms of vibe and energy. Great for business traveler, not so much for the vacationer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: I'm a very demanding traveller and accustomed to impeccable service and great hotels. I must say this is one of the finest 5 Star hotels I've every stayed in. Staff & Service Simply amazing. GENUINELY friendly and service oriented staff. This is Four Seasons style service at a Shangri-La. Requests were met promptly and with pleasure. All staff from room service, housekeeping, dining room, concierge to doormen were world class. Exceptionally well trained but their level of service goes beyond training. This is an amazing team who genuinely enjoys serving and takes great pride in their lovely hotel and a job well done. Facilities Stunning hotel with no expense spared. The renovation of this stately mansion is impressive. Rooms are sparkling new and very tastefully decorated. Be careful with room selection as a terrace and Eiffel Tower view are important. As with many historiic hotels rooms are not standardized "cookie-cutter" shaped. If you have specific requirements for view or space, etc I would be very specific when making your reservation. We viewed a number of rooms and suites and highly recommend the Eiffel Tower view rooms with a terrace. We preferred this room to the suites we viewed. Location Some reviews bemoan the location of the Shangri-La but we found it convenient to everything. Paris is the ultimate walking city so go out walk around and enjoy. The Shang is in a gorgeous neighborhood of Embassies and is low key and discrete. Dining We enjoyed room service and the morning breakfast. Deliciously prepared food served by a terrific staff. Dinner would be a special treat at either of the two venues but we were both very casually dressed and it did not feel appropraite to dine in these elegant venues without proper attire. Having stayed at Le Meurice, The Ritz and the Crillon on previous stays I must say the Shangri La Paris is by far the finest option out of this group of famed hotels. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: GPR21
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite at this hotel for 3 nights in July. Staff were all great especially the concierges and restaurant staff . The rooms were new and comfortable. Had a small issue with a film crew using the hotel for a shoot. This is an excellent small hotel in Paris which is a good alternative to George V and should only get better with time. We used Greg at Whatahotel to book this hotel and he provided his usual great service and benefits as we had to change our arrival date quite a few times

Reviews.Title: “100% Great room and Great service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: feliciamintarya
Reviews.Content: I spent incredible 6 nights in this cosy and luxurious hotel. The most important thing in a hotel is their bathroom Their bathroom is comfortably clean and spacious. theres a 24 hr heater to prevent you feel cold after shower. damn relaxing. The moment i enter the room, i feel like im in my own room in Indonesia. i really feel like im in asia but with elegance touch of paris. Im an asian, sometimes i do still feel racism in some western countries hotels. I can feel that they are not sincere when they serve asian. However, this hotel is definitely different. The concierge was really friendly and helpfull. Theres one a sudden change in the forecast, they reminded me and lended me their umbrella. They were so thoughtfull. And they also helped me with dinner reservations and willing to contact me via SMS when i was outside. Definitely a come back!!! I also love the bulgari parfums that they always spray in every Shangrilla hotel in the world. Success for Shangrilla!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient! Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: CJMTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Paris is by far the most elegant hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying. Attentive but not obtrusive staff. Rooms are well appointed and surprisingly large. Check in is done in the privacy of your room. Beautiful welcome with lovely tea service. My room overlooked the Eiffel Tower with an amazing view of the city. Whether for business or vacation this is definitely a hotel you can count on for service. Restaurant was amazing. Hotel is located in a neighborhood and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and shopping. Will DEFINITELY return!

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: CWMB
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a wonderful stay at the Shangri-La in Paris. The room was a duplex suite of an excellent standard. The service was outstanding, our every need was catered for. We ate at the main restaurant, La Bauhinia, the food at both breakfast and dinner was of a very high standard. I was particularly impressed at the range of choice available at dinner, there were both european and asian options. I would also recomend the cocktails in the bar, one of my favourites being the pink lady which I believe is linked to the history of the building. The location is fantastic with Eiffel views. If you're going to Paris and want to be well looked after go to the Shang!

Reviews.Title: “Dreams Do Come True”
Reviews.Author: NYJohnny73
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the gates of the Shangri La Paris, all the stress began to melt away. Snowstorms in the U.S. and a cancelled flight for my partner, were getting our quick trip to Paris of to a very rough start. The friendliness and assistance of the doormen was greatly appreciated after a red-eye flight. The lobby and registration staff were all attentive and quite expeditious in getting me to my room. I must say that our room may have been one of the most exquisite rooms in all of Paris. A corner suite with a wrap around terrace you access via dormer windows reveals unto its guests the most incredible view of the Eiffel Tower. I knew instantly that I had a vantage point that most Parisians will never have. The welcome amenity of hot tea and fresh fruit was greatly appreciated and helped to wipe some of the cobwebs away. After my bags quickly arrived, I took a few moments to check out the room as a whole. Very tasteful with a classic elegance. The closet area and bathrooms (1 full and 1 half) were very well appointed. RADIANT HEAT FLOORS IN THE MASTER BATHROOM!!! If you have never experienced it before, you will never want to live without it again. I found the hotel's location near the Trocadero to be quite convenient, especially as there is a metro station just around the corner. Of course the short walk down to the bridge and over the river to the Eiffel Tower is a must. We also found the Arc de Triomphe and Champs D'Elysee to be quite nearby too. On the second day, upon the arrival of my partner, we partook of the dining room at La Bauhinia, just off the hotel's lobby. What a delicious and decadent lunch by Chef Philippe Labbé. I long for the venison main course again. The service was top notch and the room was a beautiful oasis for our meal. We were privileged enough to see the ballrooms on the second floor. (We just asked and were shown around as the gentleman said he had a moment and there were no events underway at the time. I felt like I was back in Versaille. The details of the restoration are phenomenal. It truly was like being in a world class museum. Yes, I know that this hotel can be worth a pretty penny, but for a moment to relax, leave reality, and/or share a special moment, I can think of no other place I would rather be in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION IN PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: rarditti
Reviews.Content: What a dream hotel the new Shanrgi-La in Paris is! The company has spared no expense to renovate the old Roland Bonaparte palace. The property is the epitome of elegance and luxury with all the highest standards in modern convenience. The views of the Eiffel Tower are nothing short of breathtaking. This is the perfect hotel for a romantic getaway (as it is in a residential area so no hustle and bustle of the city yet convenient to everything) or even better, to propose marriage. The service is world class and superb. The cuisine in the restaurants match the quality of haute cuisine restaurants in the vicinity. The new Shangri-la is a real jewel in a city already famous for its luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “100% luxury”
Reviews.Author: Anton_Pekkari
Reviews.Content: Good points: - very beautiful historical building after recent restoration - spacious rooms with terrace and Eifeil tower view (from some rooms) - central location - fabulous real 6 star service - gastronomic restaurant - free wi-fi Bad points - Very expensive but you can understand why it costs so much

Reviews.Title: “A complete wow experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rimfree
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing our stay at this remarkable new hotel, and we have no doubt it will take it's rightful place as the premier luxury hotel in Paris. This extraordinary oasis is simply divine, and Trip Advisor needs to consider a new scale to measure it because this hotel is a "10"! The service is a wow from the very first moment if arrival. The bellmen are friendly and kind, and knowledgeable as well, as are all the staff of the hotel. By the second, the entire staff greets you by name, and everyone works hard to go out of their way to please. The concierge is outstanding and very accommodating. We cannot say enough good things about the staff, from housekeeping to the restaurants to the reception and concierge desks, this hotel is as buttoned up and meticulous as can be. The breakfast, which is the only meal we ate in the hotel is excellent, simple, delicious, and beatifuly prepared. The restaurant itself has the most peaceful and exquisite ambience. The hotel itself is a bit off the beaten path, in a more elegant and less touristy neighborhood, but a short 10 or 15 minute walk from the Champs Élysées or Avenue Montaigne. Great cafes and brasseries in the neighborhood as well, just a few short blocks away. Oh, did we mention the room, the spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower, the cool smooth sheets and duvet on the delicious bed, and the wonderful surprise of the radiant bathroom floors. Eve the water pressure is fantastic. It's the simple things that make a hotel stay special, and at the Shangri-la Paris, these simple things do indeed add up to a magical experience. We will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A new palace is born”
Reviews.Author: Adult44
Reviews.Content: The new Shangri-La Paris is not meant to be a "value" but rather an indulgence. The former residence of Napoleon's grand nephew it's like a brand-new museum. The recently completed 4-year renovation wows from the entry and never stops. The staff are superb, the restaurant sumptuous and the rooms heavenly -- I didn't want to turn the lights out at night, in case I woke up, I wanted to see it again! A tour of the public meeting rooms on the first floor (2nd floor for Americans) was like stepping back in time. And the free internet was wonderfully unexpected where luxury hotels typically feel the need to pickpocket their well-heeled guests (€20 at Four Seasons).

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in the heart of Paris with views of the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: LKLBP22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in the new Shangri-La hotel and had an amazing experience. The hotel and rooms are top notch with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. The staff was friendly and could not have been more helpful. We discovered the hotel through this article (http://www.bonjourparis.com/story/shangri-la-buzz/) on Bonjour Paris. This website was extremely helpful and gave us some insight into restaurants and things to do while in Paris. Although the hotel was expensive, we were there to celebrate our anniversary and I will say that it was an incredible experience and worth every dime. I can only hope that we are fortunate enough to stay at the Shangri-La again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, beautiful room, great views of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Harriet15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. The staff couldn't have done more to be helpful, particularly Tony @ concierge. Our room was perfect with incredible views of the Eiffel Tower directly outside the window. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: rolandmuc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so beautiful, the location is great with a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower from our room. The staff treats you like a VIP and greet you by name. Linda Leveque from Guest Relations is absolutely professionell and really cares about you. The best hotel in Paris. The only negative thing are the room rates. But you get a perfect room with wonderful beds.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the rest, this is just the ultimate place”
Reviews.Author: becinsydney
Reviews.Content: Haven't checked out yet and don't want to! This place is just the beez neez. Move over FS George V, this new beautiful hotel in the heart of Paris is everything and more than you would expect. Exceptional service, exquisite finishes and AMAZING staff. Nothing is too much trouble here at the Shangri-La. Travelled through 40 countries and this hotel is without a doubt a six star rating. Incredible rooms, great food, outstanding concierge, fantastic housekeeping - I could go on and on. Truly a new benchmark in Paris and definitely for the Shangri-La group. Imagine being addressed by every single staff member by your name - don't know how they do it! Beautifully dressed team. Hope to see many more of these in new locations around the globe. Thank you everyone for making our stay so memorable. Make it a place you visit. Our 7 day stay worth every dollar!

HotelInfo.Name: Shangri-La Hotel Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 10 avenue d'Iena, 75116 Paris, France
